sentences: Matteo, mijito de mi vida, thank you for helping you poor abuelita with this community Altar for Dias de los Muerto! I’m so happy that you’re here.
We’re almost done with the decorations and festivities. Ohh I’m so excited. Matteo, mijo, can you help your abuelita get the final pieces of the altar?
Que? Como que no vas a aydar! Matteo! Don’t make me get my chancal!
Gracias mijito. Now I need you to go around town to get the last of the decorations.
Don Fransisco has the last sugar skulls we need. Go to his store to see if he finally has them.  El Don said he’d help for the past 2 days but this man has done nothing!
El Flaco, Felipe, has some candles for the Altar too. Last I saw him he was in the plaza watching los pajaritos.
Little Sofia made some little papel picado for the Altar too. I remember she would always help Oscar with painting the town so I’m sure she would love to help the altar.
Vangas patrace when you have everything mijo. You can keep playing with the ball mijo, but don’t get too distracted jugando.
Hola mijito, did you get all the decorations?
Oh that's great. Why don't you...
Mijo, it looks like you’re still missing a couple of decorations. Porque estas mentirando to your abuelita? Vas a ver Matteo!
Estas bien mijo. Just don’t forget where you need to go for the decorations.
Go check the store to see if Don Fransisco has the rest of the sugar skulls for the Altar.
Felipe said he has some spare candles to give. Check la plaza to see if he actually does or not.
Sofia also has some papel picado for the altar too. Va a la escuela to find her.
Come back when you have everything Mijo. Gracias y me amo!
Hola mijito, did you get all the decorations?
Candy, Candles, papel. Mijo that’s everything!
Aww I’m so happy Matteo. Soy muy muy muy feliz. Tu Abuelito would be so proud of you mijito. I can just imagine it now, his espiritue just smiling down on you.
Gracias Matteo. Now let’s get everyone the celebrate este Dia De Los Muetros con everyone.
